serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
United States 110th Congressional Districts represents the political boundaries for the U.S. 110th Congressional Districts. The membership is current as of May 1, 2008. Attribute information includes the state, district number, and area of the district as well as the name and party affiliation of the representative.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States 110th Congressional Districts provides the locations of Congressional Districts, primarily for national planning applications.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:1,000,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:

For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1746

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete:
After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
Line simplification and smoothing was performed with a tolerance of 0.005 decimal degrees and a coordinate reduction using the Douglas-Peucker method with a tolerance of 0.0003 decimal degrees. Very small polygons were eliminated when the combination of geographic codes existed elsewhere.

serinfo.issue: 2007 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

citeinfo.title: 2006 Second Edition TIGER/Line Files, 2008
citeinfo.othercit: Provided the congressional district boundaries for Pennsylvania, Georgia, and Texas.

citeinfo.origin: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives
citeinfo.title: MEMBER INFORMATION

pubinfo.publish: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Copied the ESRI Data & Maps 2007 U.S. 109th Congressional Districts (CD) shapefile. Downloaded Pennsylvania, Georgia, and Texas from the U.S. Census Bureau website. Used ArcGIS for Pennsylvania and Feature Manipulation Engine (FME) for Georgia and Texas to merge TIGER/Line files by state into shapefiles, and then dissolved on source CDCU code to create the final congressional districts. Replaced the old data with the new for Pennsylvania, Georgia, and Texas in the data set to create the new 110th CD shapefile. Compared NAME and PARTY attribute values to information at http://clerk.house.gov/member_info/olm110.html, and updated any necessary values. Calculated new values for the SQMI attribute. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

enttyp.enttypd: An area established by state officials or the courts for the purpose of electing a person to the U.S. House of Representatives. Within each state, these areas must contain, as nearly as possible, an equal number of inhabitants. The number of congressional districts in each state may change after each decennial census, and the boundaries may be changed more than once during a decade.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The name of the representative for the congressional district.
attr.attrdefs: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives

attr.attrdef: The political party of the representative for the congressional district.
attr.attrdefs: Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives

edom.edomvd: The representative has resigned, died, or declined to serve.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state in which the congressional district is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the congressional district is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The area of the congressional district in square miles.
